content.raw: As a compromise, we could have our cmake config files provide both versioned and unversioned copies of the variables. That way, if someone isn't concerned about version conflicts, they can use the unversioned copies, while people who do need to be concerned about such conflicts can make use of the versioned copies.
content.html: As a compromise, we could have our cmake config files provide both versioned and unversioned copies of the variables. That way, if someone isn't concerned about version conflicts, they can use the unversioned copies, while people who do need to be concerned about such conflicts can make use of the versioned copies.
